fields.desc: This field identifies the type of document (as defined in the transcription system). Refer to user-defined table 0270 - Document type for suggested values. The organization is free to add more entries.

fields.name: Document Content Presentation
fields.desc: This is a conditional field which is required whenever the message contains content as presented in one or more OBX segments. This field identifies the method by which this document was obtained or originated. Refer to HL7 table 0191 - Type of referenced data for valid values.

fields.name: Activity Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time identified in the document as the date a procedure or activity was performed. This date can identify date of surgery, non-invasive procedure, consultation, examination, etc.

fields.name: Primary Activity Provider Code/Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name of the person identified in the document as being responsible for performing the procedure or activity. This field includes the code and name (if available) of the caregiver. This field is conditional based upon the presence of a value in TXA-4-activity date/time .
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Origination Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time the document was created (i.e., dictated, recorded, etc.).

fields.name: Transcription Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time the input was actually transcribed. This field is conditional based upon the presence of a value in TXA-17-document completion status of anything except 'dictated.'

fields.name: Edit Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time the document was edited.

fields.name: Originator Code/Name
fields.desc: This field identifies the person who originated (i.e., dictated) the document. The document originator may differ from the person responsible for authenticating the document.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Assigned Document Authenticator
fields.desc: This field identifies the person(s) responsible for authenticating the document, who may differ from the originator. Multiple persons may be responsible for authentication, especially in teaching facilities. This field is allowed to repeat an undefined number of times.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Transcriptionist Code/Name
fields.desc: This field identifies the person transcribing the document. This is a conditional value; it is required on all transcribed documents.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Unique Document Number
fields.desc: This field contains a unique document identification number assigned by the sending system. This document number is used to assist the receiving system in matching future updates to the document, as well as to identify the document in a query. When the vendor does not provide a unique document ID number, some type of document identifier should be entered here, or the Unique Document File name should be utilized. See Chapter 2, Section 2.8.49, 'XTN - extended telecommunication number.' Where the system does not customarily have a document filler number, this number could serve as that value, as well.

fields.name: Parent Document Number
fields.desc: This field contains a document number that identifies the parent document to which this document belongs. The parent document number can be used to assist the receiving system in matching future updates to this document. This is a conditional field that is always required on T05 (document addendum notification), T06 (document addendum notification and content), T09 (document replacement notification), and T10 (document replacement notification and content) events.

fields.name: Placer Order Number
fields.desc: This field is the placer application's order number.

fields.name: Filler Order Number
fields.desc: This field is the order number associated with the filling application. Where a transcription service or similar organization creates the document and uses an internally unique identifier, that number should be inserted in this field. Its first component is a string of characters that identifies an order detail segment (e.g., OBR). This string must uniquely identify the order (as specified in the order detail segment) from other orders in a particular filling application (e.g., transcription service). This uniqueness must persist over time. Where a number is reused over time, a date can be affixed to the non-unique number to make it unique.

fields.name: Unique Document File Name
fields.desc: This field contains a unique name assigned to a document by the sending system. The file name is used to assist the receiving system in matching future updates to the document.

fields.name: Document Completion Status
fields.desc: This field identifies the current completion state of the document. This is a required, table-driven field. Refer to HL7 table 0271 - Document completion status for valid values.

fields.name: Document Confidentiality Status
fields.desc: This is an optional field which identifies the degree to which special confidentiality protection should be applied to this information. The assignment of data elements to these categories is left to the discretion of the healthcare organization. Refer to HL7 table 0272 - Document confidentiality status for valid values.

fields.name: Document Availability Status
fields.desc: This is an optional field which identifies a document's availability for use in patient care. If an organization's business rules allow a document to be used for patient care before it is authenticated, the value of this field should be set to 'AV.' If a document has been made available for patient care, it cannot be changed or deleted. If an erroneous document has been made available at any point in time and a replacement is not appropriate, then it may be marked as 'Canceled' and removed, as in the case of a document being assigned to the wrong patient. Additional information must be provided via an addendum, which is separately authenticated and date/time stamped. If the content of a document whose status is 'Available' must be revised, this is done by issuing a replacement, which is separately authenticated and date/time stamped. Refer to HL7 table 0273 - Document availability status for valid values.

fields.name: Document Storage Status
fields.desc: This optional field identifies the storage status of the document. Refer to HL7 table 0275 - Document storage status for valid values.

fields.name: Document Change Reason
fields.desc: This free text field (limited to 30 characters) contains the reason for document status change.

fields.name: Authentication Person, Time Stamp
fields.desc: This is a conditional field. When the status of TXA-17-document completion status is equal to AU (authenticated) or LA (legally authenticated), all components are required. This field contains a set of components describing by whom and when authentication was performed. Whenever any one of the ID number - Name type code component s is valued, the when authenticated component, which is time stamp, must be valued as non-null. If the time component of a set is valued as non-null, the person component becomes required. These subcomponents are normally delimited by an ampersand (&). See Chapter 2.

fields.name: Distributed Copies
fields.desc: This field identifies the persons who received a copy of this document.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Give Sub-ID Counter
fields.desc: Use if this RXG segment carries information about a single administration. Starts with 1 for the first scheduled give date/time transmitted by the pharmacy/treatment supplier for this order. Increments by one with each additional scheduled give date/time for this order.

fields.name: Dispense Sub-ID Counter
fields.desc: This is the dispense sub-ID to which this give message is related.

fields.name: Quantity/Timing
fields.desc: This field contains the quantity/timing specification that refers to either a single scheduled give instruction only or to multiple give instructions. In the former case, RXG-1-give sub-ID counter is a positive integer greater than or equal to one (1). In the latter case, RXG-1-give sub-ID counter is zero (0). The quantity will always be 1. This quantity/timing field may differ from the ORC quantity/timing field, which contains the requested quantity/timing of the original order.

fields.name: Give Code
fields.desc: This field is the identifier of the medical substance ordered to be given to the patient; it is equivalent to OBR-4-universal service ID in function. See the RXE segment for a complete definition of the RXE-2-give code. If the substance given is a vaccine, CVX codes may be used to code this field (see HL7 table 0292 - Vaccines administered).

fields.name: Give Amount - Minimum
fields.desc: This field contains the ordered amount as encoded by the pharmacy/treatment supplier. In a variable dose order, this is the minimum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose order, this is the exact amount of the order.

fields.name: Give Amount - Maximum
fields.desc: In a variable dose order, this is the maximum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose order, this field is not used.

fields.name: Give Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units for the give amount.

fields.name: Give Dosage Form
fields.desc: The dosage form indicates the manner in which the medication is aggregated for dispensing, e.g., tablets, capsules, suppositories. In some cases, this information is implied by the give code in RXG-4-give code . Use this field when the give code does not specify the dosage form.

fields.name: Administration Notes
fields.desc: This field contains notes to the person administering the medication (may include the ordering provider's original notes, as well as any notes from the formulary or the pharmacy or treatment supplier). If coded, a user-defined table must be used. If free text, place a null in the first component and the text in the second, e.g., |^this is a free text administration note|.

fields.name: Substitution Status
fields.desc: Refer to HL7 table 0167 - Substitution status for valid values.

fields.name: Dispense-To Location
fields.desc: The first component contains the inpatient or outpatient location where the drug or treatment was dispensed (if applicable). The default (null) value is the current census location for the patient. Site-specific table. The first eight components have the same form as the first eight components of PV1-3-assigned patient location. The final eight components replace the ninth component of PV1-3-assigned patient location and represent the full address specification.

fields.name: Needs Human Review
fields.desc: Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values. The values have the following meaning for this field:

fields.name: Pharmacy/Treatment Supplier s Special Administration Instructions
fields.desc: This field contains pharmacy/treatment supplier-generated special instructions to the provider administering the order.

fields.name: Give Per
fields.desc: This field contains the time unit to use to calculate the rate at which the pharmaceutical is to be administered.

fields.name: Give Rate Amount
fields.desc: This field contains the amount (number) of substance to be administered.

fields.name: Give Rate Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units for RXG-15-give rate amount . May be composite. The ratio of the RXG-15-give rate amount and RXG-16-give rate units fields define the actual rate of administration. Thus, if RXG-15-give rate amount = 100 and RXG-16-give rate units = ml/hr, the requested rate of administration is 100 ml/hr.

fields.name: Give Strength
fields.desc: Use when RXG-4-give code does not specify the strength. This is the numeric part of the strength, used in combination with RXG-18-give strength units.

fields.name: Give Strength Units
fields.desc: Use when RXG-4-give code does not specify the strength. This is the unit of the strength, used in combination with RXG-17-give strength.

fields.name: Substance Lot Number
fields.desc: This field contains the lot number of the medical substance administered.

fields.name: Substance Expiration Date
fields.desc: This field contains the expiration date of the medical substance administered.

fields.name: Substance Manufacturer Name
fields.desc: This field contains the manufacturer of the medical substance administered.

fields.name: Indication
fields.desc: This field contains the identifier of the condition or problem for which the drug/treatment was prescribed. May repeat if multiple indications are relevant.

fields.name: Study Phase Identifier
fields.desc: This field identifies the phase of the study that a patient has entered. The set of codes will generally be developed for each clinical trial, although there are patterns that trials in particular disease or prevention categories may follow. The phase structure will be based on data collation and reporting needs for the study. It is an operational structure and need not be discussed in the clinical trial protocol documentation or even made known to patient care or data collection personnel. The coding system will usually be developed by the sponsor for multicentered clinical trials to standardize the receipt of automated data. Local codes could be added if an additional local message is desired. Otherwise, local coding conventions will be used. Example: 2^Init Rx, Crs 1^NCI T93-0807 Phases

fields.name: Date/time Study Phase Began
fields.desc: This field contains the date the patient began this phase interval. The time is optional.

fields.name: Date/time Study Phase Ended
fields.desc: This field contains the date the patient ended this phase interval.

fields.name: Study Phase Evaluability
fields.desc: This field contains the disposition of the patient's data for this phase interval for quality control and data analysis purposes. The set of codes will vary across clinical trials. An example answer set: Complete, Adverse Events Only, Outcome Only, None, Unknown.

fields.name: Prior Pending Location
fields.desc: This field is required for cancel pending transfer (A27 (cancel pending admit)) messages. In all other events it is optional.

fields.name: Accommodation Code
fields.desc: This field indicates the specific patient accommodations for this visit. User-defined table 0129 - Accommodation code is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table for values for this field.

fields.name: Admit Reason
fields.desc: This field contains the short description of the reason for patient admission.

fields.name: Transfer Reason
fields.desc: This field contains the short description of the reason for a patient location change.

fields.name: Patient Valuables
fields.desc: This field contains the short description of patient valuables checked in during admission.

fields.name: Patient Valuables Location
fields.desc: This field indicates the location of the patient's valuables.

fields.name: Visit User Code
fields.desc: This field further categorizes a patient's visit with respect to an individual institution's needs (e.g., teaching flag = TE, indicating the patient is a teaching case). User-defined table 0130 - Visit user code is used as the HL7 identifier or the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Expected Admit Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be admitted. This field is also used to reflect the date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient registration.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time that the patient is expected to be discharged. This is a non-event related date used by ancillaries to determine more accurately the projected workloads. This field is also used to reflect the anticipated discharge date/time of an outpatient/emergency patient, or an inpatient.

fields.name: Estimated Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.desc: This field specifies the estimated days of inpatient stays.

fields.name: Actual Length of Inpatient Stay
fields.desc: This field contains the actual days of inpatient stays. The actual length of the inpatient stay may not be calculated from the admission and discharge dates because of possible leaves of absence.

fields.name: Visit Description
fields.desc: This field contains a brief user-defined description of the visit.

fields.name: Referral Source Code
fields.desc: This field contains the name and the identification numbers of the person or organization that made the referral. This person/organization is not the same as the referring doctor. For example, Joe Smith referred me to the Clinic (or to Dr. Jones at the Clinic).
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Previous Service Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date of previous service for the same recurring condition. This may be a required field for billing certain illnesses (e.g., accident related) to a third party.

fields.name: Employment Illness Related Indicator
fields.desc: This field specifies whether a patient's illness was job-related. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Purge Status Code
fields.desc: This field contains the purge status code for the account. It is used by the application program to determine purge processing. Refer to user-defined table 0213 - Purge status for suggested values.

fields.name: Purge Status Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date on which the data will be purged from the system.

fields.name: Special Program Code
fields.desc: This field designates the specific health insurance program for a visit required for healthcare reimbursement. Examples include Child Health Assistance, Elective Surgery Program, Family Planning, etc. User-defined table 0214 - Special program codes is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Retention Indicator
fields.desc: This field allows the user to control the financial and demographic purge processes at the visit. It is used to preserve demographic and financial data on specific, high priority visits. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Number of Insurance Plans
fields.desc: This field contains the number of insurance plans that may provide coverage for this visit.

fields.name: Visit Publicity Code
fields.desc: This field contains a user-defined code indicating what level of publicity is allowed (e.g., No Publicity, Family Only) for a specific visit. User-defined table 0215 - Publicitycode is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. Refer to PD1-11- publicity code for the patient level publicity code.

fields.name: Visit Protection Indicator
fields.desc: This field identifies the person's protection that determines, in turn, whether access to information about this person should be kept from users who do not have adequate authority for a specific visit. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values. Refer to PD1-12- protection indicator for the patient level protection indicator.

fields.name: Clinic Organization Name
fields.desc: This field contains the organization name or sub-unit and identifier that is associated with the (visit) episode of care. For example, the Allergy or Oncology Clinic within the facility might be named.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations

fields.name: Patient Status Code
fields.desc: This field indicates the status of the episode of care: for instance, Active Inpatient vs. Discharged Inpatient. Refer to user defined table0216 - Patient status for suggested values.

fields.name: Visit Priority Code
fields.desc: This field contains the priority of the visit, e.g., whether the admission is an emergency, elective, or urgent. Refer to user defined table 0217 - Visit priority for suggested values.

fields.name: Previous Treatment Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date that the patient last had treatment for any condition prior to this visit. In the case of a prior hospital visit, it is likely to be the previous discharge date.

fields.name: Expected Discharge Disposition
fields.desc: This field describes what the patient's disposition is expected to be at the end of the visit. Refer to user-defined table 0112 - Discharged disposition for suggested values.

fields.name: Signature on File Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date on which a signature was obtained for insurance billing purposes.

fields.name: First Similar Illness Date
fields.desc: This field is used to determine if the patient has a pre-existing condition.

fields.name: Patient Charge Adjustment Code
fields.desc: This field contains a user-defined code that indicates which adjustments should be made to this patient's charges. User-defined table 0218 - Charge adjustment is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. This field is the same as GT1-26-guarantor charge adjustment code .

fields.name: Recurring Service Code
fields.desc: This field indicates whether the treatment is continuous. User-defined table 0219 - Recurring service is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Billing Media Code
fields.desc: This field indicates if the account is to be rejected from tape billing. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Expected Surgery Date & Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time on which the surgery is expected to occur.

fields.name: Military Partnership Code
fields.desc: This field indicates that a military facility has contracted with a non-military facility for the use of its services. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Military Non-Availability Code
fields.desc: This field indicates whether a patient has permission to use a non-military facility for treatment. Refer to Chapter 2 , HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Newborn Baby Indicator
fields.desc: This field indicates whether the patient is a baby. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Baby Detained Indicator
fields.desc: This field indicates if the baby is detained after the mother's discharge. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Requested Give Code
fields.desc: This field identifies the medical substance or product ordered to be given to the patient; it is equivalent to OBR-4-universal service ID in function. The request-to-dispense fields, which define the type and amount of what is to be issued to the patient (see RXO-10 requested dispense code , RXO-11-requested dispense amount, and RXO-12-requested dispense units ), do not necessarily correlate with the instructions of what amount is to be 'given' or administered with each dose, and may or may not be specified with the order. For example, the 'give' part of the order may convey the field-representation of give 15 mg of Librium every 6 hours, while the request to dispense part of the order may convey issue 30 tablets of 10 mg generic equivalent for this outpatient prescription . When the give code does not include the dosage form, use RXO-5-requested dosage form.

fields.name: Requested Give Amount - Minimum
fields.desc: This field is the ordered amount. In a variable dose order, this is the minimum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose order, this is the exact amount of the order.

fields.name: Requested Give Amount - Maximum
fields.desc: In a variable dose order, this is the maximum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose order, this field is not used.

fields.name: Requested Give Units
fields.desc: This field indicates the units for the give amount.

fields.name: Requested Dosage Form
fields.desc: This field indicates the manner in which the medication is aggregated for dispensing, e.g., tablets, capsules, suppositories. In some cases, this information is implied by the dispense/give code in RXO-1-requested give code or RXO-10-requested dispense code. Use when both RXO-1-requested give code and RXO-10-requested dispense code do not specify the drug/treatment form.

fields.name: Provider s Pharmacy/Treatment Instructions
fields.desc: This field identifies the ordering provider's instructions to the pharmacy or the non-pharmacy treatment provider (e.g., respiratory therapy). If coded, a user-defined table must be used. If transmitted as a free text field, place a null in the first component and the text in the second, e.g., |^this is a free text treatment instruction|.

fields.name: Provider s Administration Instructions
fields.desc: This field identifies the ordering provider's instructions to the patient or to the provider administering the drug or treatment. If coded, a user-defined table must be used. If transmitted as free text, place a null in the first component and the text in the second, e.g., |^this is a free text administration instruction|.

fields.name: Deliver-to Location
fields.desc: The first components, modeled after the PL data type, contain the inpatient or outpatient location to which the pharmacy provider or treatment supplier is to deliver the drug or treatment device (if applicable). The default (null) value is the current census location for the patient. This component has the same form as PV1-3-assigned patient location. The last component can be used to specify an address. This could be used to fill mail orders to a patient or provider, or to account for home health care.

fields.name: Allow Substitutions
fields.desc: Following are the values:

fields.name: Requested Dispense Code
fields.desc: This field indicates what is to be/was dispensed; it is equivalent to OBR-4-universal service ID in function. It may be present in the order or not, depending on the application. If not present, and values are given for RXO-11-requested dispense amount and RXO-12-requested dispense units , the RXO-1-requested give code is assumed. If the requested dispense code does not include the dosage form, use RXO-5-requested dosage form .

fields.name: Requested Dispense Amount
fields.desc: This field specifies the amount to be dispensed.

fields.name: Requested Dispense Units
fields.desc: This field identifies the units for the dispense amount. This must be in simple units that reflect the actual quantity of the substance to be dispensed. It does not include compound units.

fields.name: Number Of Refills
fields.desc: This field defines the number of times the requested dispense amount can be given to the patient, subject to local regulation. Refers to outpatient only.

fields.name: Ordering Provider s DEA Number
fields.desc: This field identifies the provider's controlled substance number, if required by site. It is defined as conditional because it is required when the substance being requested is a controlled substance (e.g., a narcotic).
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier s Verifier ID
fields.desc: This field is the provider ID of the pharmacist/treatment substance supplier verifier. Use if required by the pharmacy or treatment application or site on orders (or some subgroup of orders), in addition to ORC-11-verified by.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Needs Human Review
fields.desc: This field uses HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator . The values have the following meaning for this field:

fields.name: Requested Give Per
fields.desc: This field identifies the time unit to use to calculate the rate at which the pharmaceutical is to be administered.

fields.name: Requested Give Strength
fields.desc: Use this field when RXO-1-requested give code does not specify the strength. This is the numeric part of the strength, used in combination with RXO-19-requested give strength units.

fields.name: Requested Give Strength Units
fields.desc: Use when both RXO-1-requested give code and RXO-10-requested dispense code do not specify the strength. This is the unit of the strength, used in combination with RXO-18-requested give strength .

fields.name: Indication
fields.desc: This field identifies the condition or problem for which the drug/treatment was prescribed. May repeat if multiple indications are relevant.

fields.name: Requested Give Rate Amount
fields.desc: This field contains the rate at which to administer treatment.

fields.name: Requested Give Rate Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units in which RXO-21-requested give rate amount is denominated.

fields.name: Total Daily Dose
fields.desc: This field contains the total daily dose for this particular pharmaceutical as expressed in terms of actual dispense units.

fields.name: Set ID - NTE
fields.desc: This field may be used where multiple NTE segments are included in a message. Their numbering must be described in the application message definition.

fields.name: Source of Comment
fields.desc: This field is used when source of comment must be identified. This table may be extended locally during implementation.

fields.name: Comment
fields.desc: This field contains the comment contained in the segment.

fields.name: Comment Type
fields.desc: This field contains a value to identify the type of comment text being sent in the specific comment record. Refer to user-defined table 0364-Comment type for suggested values.

fields.name: Set ID - IN3
fields.desc: IN3-1-set ID-IN3 contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment the sequence number shall be 1, for the second occurrence it shall be 2, etc. The set ID in the IN3 segment is used when there are multiple certifications for the insurance plan identified in IN1-2.

fields.name: Certification Number
fields.desc: This field contains the number assigned by the certification agency. The assigning authority and identifier type code are strongly recommended for all CX data types.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: Certified By
fields.desc: This field contains the party that approved the certification. Multiple names and identifiers for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Certification Required
fields.desc: This field indicates whether certification is required. Refer to HL7table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Penalty
fields.desc: This field contains the penalty, in dollars or a percentage, that will be assessed if the pre-certification is not performed. Refer to user-defined table 0148 - Penalty type for suggested values.

fields.name: Certification Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time stamp that indicates when insurance was certified to exist for the patient.

fields.name: Certification Modify Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time that the certification was modified.

fields.name: Operator
fields.desc: This field contains the name party who is responsible for sending this certification information. Multiple names for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Certification Begin Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date that this certification begins.

fields.name: Certification End Date
fields.desc: This field contains date that this certification ends.

fields.name: Days
fields.desc: This field contains the number of days for which this certification is valid. This field applies to denied, pending, or approved days. Refer to user-defined table 0149 - Day type for suggested values.

fields.name: Non-Concur Code/Description
fields.desc: This field contains the non-concur code and description for a denied request. User-defined table 0233 - Non-concur code/description is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Non-Concur Effective Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the effective date of the non-concurrence classification.

fields.name: Physician Reviewer
fields.desc: This field contains the physician who works with and reviews cases that are pending physician review for the certification agency. Multiple names for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2. User-defined table 0010 - Physician ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of value for this field .
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Certification Contact
fields.desc: This field contains the name of the party contacted at the certification agency who granted the certification and communicated the certification number.

fields.name: Certification Contact Phone Number
fields.desc: This field contains the phone number of the certification contact. Multiple phone numbers for the same certification contact may be sent in this sequence. The primary phone number is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the primary telephone number is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Appeal Reason
fields.desc: This field contains the reason that an appeal was made on a non-concur for certification. Refer to user-defined table 0345 - Appeal reason for suggested values.

fields.name: Certification Agency
fields.desc: This field contains the certification agency. Refer to user-defined table 0346 - Certification agency for suggested values.

fields.name: Certification Agency Phone Number
fields.desc: This field contains the phone number of the certification agency. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Pre-Certification Req/Window
fields.desc: This field indicates whether pre-certification is required for particular patient types, and the time window for obtaining the certification. The following components of this field are defined as follows:

fields.name: Case Manager
fields.desc: This field contains the name of the entity who/which is handling this particular patient's case (e.g., UR nurse, or a specific facility location).

fields.name: Second Opinion Date
fields.desc: This field contains the date that the second opinion was obtained.

fields.name: Second Opinion Status
fields.desc: This field contains the code that represents the status of the second opinion. User-defined table 0151 - Second opinion status is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table for this field. .

fields.name: Second Opinion Documentation Received
fields.desc: Use this field if accompanying documentation has been received by the provider. User-defined table 0152 - Second opinion documentation received is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Second Opinion Physician
fields.desc: This field contains an identifier and name of the physician who provided the second opinion. Multiple names and identifiers for the same person may be sent in this sequence. The legal name is assumed to be in the first repetition. When the legal name is not sent, a repeat delimiter must be sent first for the first repetition. The components of this field are described in Chapter 2. User-defined table 0010 - Physician ID is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field .
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Order Control
fields.desc: Determines the function of the order segment. Refer to HL7 table 0119 - Order control codes and their meaning for valid entries. Very detailed explanatory notes are given at the end of this section.

fields.name: Placer Order Number
fields.desc: This field is the placer application's order number.

fields.name: Filler Order Number
fields.desc: This field is the order number associated with the filling application. It is a case of the Entity Identifier data type (Section 2.8.13). Its first component is a string that identifies an order detail segment (e.g., OBR). A limit of fifteen (15) characters is suggested but not required. An implementation is HL7 compliant when the number of characters for this field is increased to accommodate applications that require a greater number of characters for the Filler order number.It is assigned by the order filler (receiving) application. This string must uniquely identify the order (as specified in the order detail segment) from other orders in a particular filling application (e.g., clinical laboratory). This uniqueness must persist over time.

fields.name: Placer Group Number
fields.desc: This field allows an order placing application to group sets of orders together and subsequently identify them. It is a case of an Entity Identifier data type (2.8.13).

fields.name: Order Status
fields.desc: This field specifies the status of an order. Refer to HL7table 0038 - Order status for valid entries. The purpose of this field is to report the status of an order either upon request (solicited), or when the status changes (unsolicited). It does not initiate action. It is assumed that the order status always reflects the status as it is known to the sending application at the time that the message is sent. Only the filler can originate the value of this field.

fields.name: Response Flag
fields.desc: This field allows the placer (sending) application to determine the amount of information to be returned from the filler. Sometimes the requested level of response may not be possible immediately, but when it is possible, the filler (receiving) application must send the information. When the field is null, D is the default value of the field. Refer to HL7table 0121 - Response flag for valid entries.

fields.name: Quantity/Timing
fields.desc: This field determines the priority, quantity, frequency, and timing of an atomic service. Order segments should be thought of as describing an atomic service. It is a composite field that is defined in detail in Section 4.4, 'Quantity/Timing (TQ) Definition.'

fields.name: Parent Order
fields.desc: This field relates a child to its parent when a parent-child relationship exists. The parent-child mechanism is described under ORC-1-order control notes.

fields.name: Date/Time of Transaction
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time the current transaction enters the ordering application. For messages creating new orders, this is the date and time the order was entered.

fields.name: Entered By
fields.desc: This field contains the identity of the person who actually keyed the request into the application. It provides an audit trail in case the request is entered incorrectly and the ancillary department needs to clarify the request. By local agreement, either the ID number or name component may be omitted.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Verified By
fields.desc: This field contains the identity of the person who verified the accuracy of the entered request. It is used in cases where the request is entered by a technician and needs to be verified by a higher authority (e.g., a nurse). By local agreement, either the ID number or name component may be omitted.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Ordering Provider
fields.desc: This field contains the identity of the person who is responsible for creating the request (i.e., ordering physician). ORC-12-ordering provider is the same as OBR-16-ordering provider.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Enterer s Location
fields.desc: This field specifies the location (e.g., nurse station, ancillary service location, clinic, floor) where the person who entered the request was physically located when the order was entered. Only those subcomponents relevant to enterer's location should be valued (commonly nursing unit; facility; building; floor). The person who entered the request is defined in ORC-10-entered by.

fields.name: Call Back Phone Number
fields.desc: This field contains the telephone number to call for clarification of a request or other information regarding the order. ORC-14-call back phone number is the same as OBR-17-order callback phone number .

fields.name: Order Effective Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time that the changes to the request took effect or are supposed to take effect.

fields.name: Order Control Code Reason
fields.desc: This field contains the explanation (either in coded or text form) of the reason for the order event described by the order control code (HL7table 0119). Whereas an NTE after the order-specific segment (e.g., RXO, ORO, OBR) would provide a comment for that specific segment, the purpose of the order control code reason is only to expand on the reason for the order event.

fields.name: Entering Organization
fields.desc: This field identifies the organization that the enterer belonged to at the time he/she enters/maintains the order, such as medical group or department. The person who entered the request is defined in ORC-10 -entered by.

fields.name: Entering Device
fields.desc: This field identifies the physical device (terminal, PC) used to enter the order.

fields.name: Action By
fields.desc: This field contains the identity of the person who initiated the event represented by the corresponding order control code. For example, if the order control code is CA (cancel order request), this field represents the person who requested the order cancellation. This person is typically a care provider but may not always be the same as ORC-12 ordering provider .
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Advanced Beneficiary Notice Code
fields.desc: This field indicates the status of the patient's or the patient's representative's consent for responsibility to pay for potentially uninsured services. This element is introduced to satisfy HCFA Medical Necessity requirements for outpatient services. This element indicates (a) whether the associated diagnosis codes for the service are subject to medical necessity procedures, (b) whether, for this type of service, the patient has been informed that they may be responsible for payment for the service, and (c) whether the patient agrees to be billed for this service. The values for this field are drawn from User-defined Table 0339 - Advanced beneficiary notice code.

fields.name: Ordering Facility Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name of the facility placing the order.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations

fields.name: Ordering Facility Address
fields.desc: This field contains the address of the facility placing the order.

fields.name: Ordering Facility Phone Number
fields.desc: This field contains the telephone number of the facility placing the order.

fields.name: Ordering Provider Address
fields.desc: This field contains the address of the care provider requesting the order.

fields.name: Contact Role
fields.desc: This field contains the contact role that defines the relationship of the person described in this segment to the patient being referred. When a referral is inter-enterprise in nature, there are some important relationships that must be identified. For example, it may be necessary to identify the contact representative at the clinic that sent the referral. User defined table 0131 - Contact role is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Contact Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name of the contact person identified in this segment. Generally, this field will describe a person or provider associated with the referral. If this contact name is a physician, you may refer to the CTD-7-contact identifiers (Section 11.5.4.7) for the physician identifier.

fields.name: Contact Address
fields.desc: This field contains the mailing address of the contact person identified in this segment. One of the key components for completing the 'circle of care' and provider/institution bonding is the issuance of follow-up correspondence to the referring provider.

fields.name: Contact Location
fields.desc: This field contains the location of the contact, which is required when a contact that may be external to a given enterprise must be referenced. For example, if this contact represents the office manager of the referred-to physician, then the contact location should identify the clinic of the physician or provider to whom this referral has been sent. The identification of the contact's location is specified by an application and facility identifier carried in the facility field. The application identifier and the facility identifier would be used in the same manner as their corresponding fields in the MSH segment ( MSH-3-sending application, MSH-5-receiving application, MSH-4-sending facility, MSH-6-receiving facility ). That is, the facility field will contain an application identifier and facility identifier which describe the location of this contact. However, it should be noted that they may describe a different location because the contact location being referenced in this field may not be the location from which the message originated, which is being described by the MSH.

fields.name: Contact Communication Information
fields.desc: This field contains the information, such as the phone number or electronic mail address, used to communicate with the contact person or organization.

fields.name: Preferred Method Of Contact
fields.desc: This field contains the preferred method to use when communicating with the contact person. Refer to user-defined table 0185 - Preferred method of contact for suggested values.

fields.name: Manufacturer/Distributor
fields.desc: This field contains the identity of the manufacturer/distributor.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite Name And Identification Number For Organizations

fields.name: Country
fields.desc: This field contains the country to which this product detail is relevant. ISO 3166 provides a list of country codes that may be used.

fields.name: Brand Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name under which the product is marketed by this manufacturer.

fields.name: Device Family Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name used by the manufacturer to describe the family of products to which this product belongs.

fields.name: Generic Name
fields.desc: This field contains the name generically used to identify the product.

fields.name: Model Identifier
fields.desc: This field contains the manufacturer's model identifier for the product.

fields.name: Catalogue Identifier
fields.desc: This field contains the manufacturer's catalogue identifier for the product.

fields.name: Other Identifier
fields.desc: This field contains any other identifier used to for the product.

fields.name: Product Code
fields.desc: This field contains the product code from an external coding system such as that used by the CDRH at the FDA.

fields.name: Marketing Basis
fields.desc: This field contains the basis for marketing approval. Refer to HL7 table 0330 - Marketingbasis for valid values.

fields.name: Marketing Approval ID
fields.desc: This field contains the designation or description of the marketing basis.

fields.name: Labeled Shelf Life
fields.desc: This field contains the shelf life of the product as labeled. This will usually be in months or years. If there is no shelf life indicated in the product labeling, this field will be empty.

fields.name: Expected Shelf Life
fields.desc: This field contains the shelf life of the product expected by the manufacturer. This will usually be in months or years.

fields.name: Date First Marketed
fields.desc: This field contains the date the product was first marketed in the country.

fields.name: Date Last Marketed
fields.desc: This field contains the date the product was last marketed in the country. This field will be omitted if the product is still being marketed.

fields.name: Set ID - UB2
fields.desc: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment the sequence number shall be 1, for the second occurrence it shall be 2, etc.

fields.name: Co-Insurance Days
fields.desc: This field contains UB92 field 9. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Condition Code
fields.desc: The code in this field can repeat up to seven times. UB92 fields 24-30. Refer to user-defined table 0043 - Condition code for suggested values. The UB codes listed as examples are not an exhaustive or current list; refer to a UB specification for additional information. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Covered Days
fields.desc: This field contains UB92 field 7. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Non-Covered Days
fields.desc: This field contains UB92 field 8. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Value Amount & Code
fields.desc: The pair in this field can repeat up to twelve times. UB92 fields 39a, 39b, 39c, 39d, 40a, 40b, 40c, 40d, 41a, 41b, 41c, and 41d. Refer to user-defined table 0153 - Value code for suggested values. The UB codes listed as examples are not an exhaustive or current list; refer to a UB specification for additional information. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Occurrence Code & Date
fields.desc: The set of values in this field can repeat up to eight times. UB92 fields 32a, 32b, 33a, 33b, 34a, 34b, 35a, and 35b. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies. Refer to user-defined table 0350 - Occurrence code for suggested values. The UB codes listed as examples are not an exhaustive or current list; refer to a UB specification for additional information.

fields.name: Occurrence Span Code/Dates
fields.desc: This field can repeat up to two times. UB92 field 36a, 36b. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies. Refer to user-defined table 0351 - Occurrence span for suggested values. The UB codes listed as examples are not an exhaustive or current list; refer to a UB specification for additional information.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 2
fields.desc: The value in this field may repeat up to two times. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 11
fields.desc: The value in this field may repeat up to two times.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 31
fields.desc: Defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: Document Control Number
fields.desc: This field contains the number assigned by payor that is used for rebilling/adjustment purposes. It may repeat up to three times. UB92 field 37

fields.name: UB92 Locator 49
fields.desc: This field may repeat up to twenty-three times. This field is defined by HCFA or other regulatory agencies.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 56
fields.desc: This field may repeat up to five times.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 57
fields.desc: Defined by UB-92 HCFA specification.

fields.name: UB92 Locator 78
fields.desc: This field may repeat up to two times.

fields.name: Special Visit Count
fields.desc: This field contains the total number of special therapy visits.

fields.name: Set ID - AIS
fields.desc: This field contains a number that uniquely identifies the information represented by this segment in this transaction for the purposes of addition, change or deletion.

fields.name: Segment Action Code
fields.desc: This field contains the action to be taken when updating or modifying information in this segment from previously sent interface transactions. Refer to HL7 table 0206 - Segment action code in Chapter 2, Section 2.23.4.2, 'Action code/unique identifier mode update definition,' for valid values.

fields.name: Universal Service ID
fields.desc: This field contains an identifier code for a service to be scheduled. This field may contain a Universal Service ID describing the observation/test/battery/procedure or other activity that is to be performed during the requested appointment, similar to the Universal Service ID defined for the OBR segment in the Order Entry chapter (Chapter 4). This code can be based on local and/or universal codes. The use of universal codes is recommended.

fields.name: Start Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time this service needs for the appointment. This field allows the application to identify that the service is required for the appointment at a different time than the appointment's start date/time

fields.name: Start Date/Time Offset
fields.desc: This field contains the offset this service needs for the appointment, expressed in units of time relative to the scheduled start date/time. This field allows the application to identify that the service is required for the appointment at a different time than the appointment's start date/time. The first component contains the offset amount. An offset of zero (0), or an unvalued field indicates that the service is required at the start date/time of the appointment.

fields.name: Start Date/Time Offset Units
fields.desc: This field contains a code describing the units of time used for expressing the start date/time offset. This field should be valued according to the recommendations in Chapters 2 and 7. If this field is not valued, the ISO base unit of seconds (code s) will be assumed. Refer to Chapter 7, Figures 7-10 through 7-13, for a list of ISO and ANSI+ unit codes.

fields.name: Duration
fields.desc: This field contains the duration for which the resource is requested/scheduled for this appointment, if different from the overall duration of the requested/scheduled appointment. This field indicates to the application that a resource is required for a different amount of time than the appointment's overall duration. An unvalued duration indicates that the resource is required from its start date/time offset (specified in the previous two fields) until the end of the appointment. If no start date/time offset is specified, then the resource is required for the full duration of the appointment.

fields.name: Duration Units
fields.desc: This field contains a code describing the units of time used for expressing the duration. This field should be valued according to the recommendations in Chapters 2 and 7. If this field is not valued, the ISO base unit of seconds (code s) will be assumed. Refer to Chapter 7, Figures 7-10 through 7-13, for a list of ISO and ANSI+ unit codes.

fields.name: Allow Substitution Code
fields.desc: This field contains a code indicating whether the identified resource can be substituted with an equivalent resource by the filler application. Refer to user-defined table 0279 - Allow substitution codes for suggested codes.

fields.name: Filler Status Code
fields.desc: This field contains a code that describes the requested/scheduled status of the resource or activity, from the point of view of the filler application. Refer to user-defined table 0278 - Filler status codes for suggested codes.

fields.name: Action Code
fields.desc: This field contains the intent of the message. Refer to HL7 table 0287 - Problem/goal action code for valid values.

fields.name: Action Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time that the operation represented by the action code was performed.

fields.name: Problem ID
fields.desc: This field identifies the problem. This is the identifier from an institution's master list of problems.

fields.name: Problem Instance ID
fields.desc: This field contains the identifier assigned by an initiating system to an instance of a problem.

fields.name: Episode of Care ID
fields.desc: This field uniquely identifies the episode of care to which this problem applies. (See note under 'Ongoing issues.')

fields.name: Problem List Priority
fields.desc: This field prioritizes this problem on a list that is maintained for the individual.

fields.name: Problem Established Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time when the corresponding problem was initially identified by the caregiver.

fields.name: Anticipated Problem Resolution Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the estimated date/time for resolving the stated problem.

fields.name: Actual Problem Resolution Date/Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time that the problem was actually resolved.

fields.name: Problem Classification
fields.desc: This field indicates the kind of problem. This field can be used to categorize problems so that they may be managed and viewed independently within different applications (e.g., admission, final, post-operative, pre-operative, outpatient, discharge, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Management Discipline
fields.desc: This field indicates the category of caregiver with responsibility for managing this specific problem (e.g., care team, nursing, medicine, respiratory therapy, occupational therapy, dietary etc.). This is a repeating field to allow identification of all disciplines who may have the responsibility for this problem.

fields.name: Problem Persistence
fields.desc: This field contains the perseverance of a problem (e.g., acute, chronic, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Confirmation Status
fields.desc: This field contains the verification status of a problem (e.g., confirmed, differential, provisional, rule-out, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Life Cycle Status
fields.desc: This field contains the current status of the problem at this particular date/time (e.g., active, active-improving, active-stable, active-worsening, inactive, resolved, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Life Cycle Status Date/Time
fields.desc: This field indicates the effective date/time of the current problem life cycle status.

fields.name: Problem Date of Onset
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time when the problem began.

fields.name: Problem Onset Text
fields.desc: This field allows for a textual representation of the time when the problem began.

fields.name: Problem Ranking
fields.desc: This field contains a user-defined prioritization of a problem (e.g., numeric ranking, or the use of words such as 'primary,' 'secondary,' etc.).

fields.name: Certainty of Problem
fields.desc: This field contains a qualitative representation of the certainty of a problem (e.g., HI - high, LO - low, ME - medium, etc.).

fields.name: Probability of Problem
fields.desc: This field contains a quantitative or numeric representation of the certainty that the problem exists for this patient. This field has a valid range of 0 to 1. For example, a healthcare provider may be 75% (.75) sure that the problem has been correctly identified.

fields.name: Individual Awareness of Problem
fields.desc: This field contains the individual's comprehension of the problem (e.g., full, marginal, partial, etc.).

fields.name: Problem Prognosis
fields.desc: This field contains the prognosis for the individual's problem (e.g., good, poor, etc.).

fields.name: Individual Awareness of Prognosis
fields.desc: This field contains the individual's comprehension of the prognosis for the problem (e.g., full, marginal, partial, etc.).

fields.name: Family/Significant Other Awareness of Problem/Prognosis
fields.desc: This field indicates the individual's family or significant other's comprehension of the actual problem/prognosis.

fields.name: Security/Sensitivity
fields.desc: This field contains information about the level of security and/or sensitivity surrounding the problem (e.g., highly sensitive, not sensitive, sensitive, etc.).

fields.name: Quantity/Timing
fields.desc: See Section 4.8.7, 'RXE - pharmacy/treatment encoded order segment,' for necessary modification for this field's definition to cover interorder dependencies needed by pharmacy/treatment orders. This field is used by the pharmacy or non-pharmacy treatment supplier to express the fully-coded version of the drug or treatment timing. It may differ from ORC-7-quantity/timing, which contains the requested quantity/timing of the original order.

fields.name: Give Code
fields.desc: This field identifies the medical substance ordered to be given to the patient, as encoded by the pharmacy or treatment supplier; it is equivalent to OBR-4-universal service ID in function. In the RXE segment, this give code must be fully encoded. The dispense fields, which define the units and amount of what is to be issued to the patient (see RXE-10-dispense amount and RXE-11-dispense units below), do not necessarily correlate with the instructions of what amount is to be 'given' or administered with each dose, and may or may not be specified with the order. For example, the 'give' part of the order may convey the field-representation of give 250 mg of Ampicillin, while the request to dispense part of the order may convey issue 30 tablets of generic equivalent for this outpatient prescription . Refer to HL7 Table 0292 - Vaccines administered for valid values.

fields.name: Give Amount - Minimum
fields.desc: This field contains the ordered amount as encoded by the pharmacy or treatment supplier. In a variable dose order, this is the minimum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose order, this is the exact amount of the order.

fields.name: Give Amount - Maximum
fields.desc: In a variable dose order, this is the maximum ordered amount. In a nonvarying dose, this field is not used.

fields.name: Give Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units for the give amount as encoded by the pharmacy or treatment (e.g., respiratory therapy) application.

fields.name: Give Dosage Form
fields.desc: The dosage form indicates the manner in which the medication is aggregated for dispensing, e.g., tablets, capsules, suppositories. In some cases, this information is implied by the give code in RXE-2-give code . Use the RXE-6-give dosage form when the give code does not specify the dosage form.

fields.name: Provider Administration Instructions
fields.desc: This field contains the ordering provider's instructions to the patient or the provider administering the drug or treatment. If coded, a user-defined table must be used; if free text (describing a custom IV, mixture, or salve, for example), place the text in the second component, e.g., |^this is a free text administration instruction| .

fields.name: Deliver-to Location
fields.desc: The first component contains the inpatient or outpatient location to which the pharmacy or treatment supplier is to deliver the drug or treatment (if applicable). The default (null) value is the current census location for the patient. Site-specific table. The first eight components have the same form as the first eight components of PV1-3-assigned patient location. The final eight components replace the ninth component of PV1-3-assigned patient location and represent the full address specification.

fields.name: Substitution Status
fields.desc: Refer to HL7 table 0167 - Substitution status for valid values. If a substitution has been made, and a record of the original requested give code (RXO-1-requested give code) is needed, the optional RXO segment can be included in the RDE message.

fields.name: Dispense Amount
fields.desc: This field contains the amount dispensed as encoded by the pharmacy or treatment supplier.

fields.name: Dispense Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units for the dispense amount as encoded by the pharmacy or treatment supplier. This field is required if the units are not implied by the actual dispense code. This must be in simple units that reflect the actual quantity of the substance dispensed. It does not include compound units.

fields.name: Number Of Refills
fields.desc: This field contains the total original number of refills. Outpatient only.

fields.name: Ordering Provider s DEA Number
fields.desc: This field is defined as conditional because it is required when the substance requested is a controlled substance (e.g., a narcotic).
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier s Verifier ID
fields.desc: This field contains the provider ID of Pharmacist/treatment supplier's verifier. Use if required by the pharmacy or treatment application or site on orders (or some subgroup of orders).
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID Number And Name For Persons

fields.name: Prescription Number
fields.desc: This field contains the prescription number as assigned by the pharmacy or treatment application. Equivalent in uniqueness to the pharmacy/treatment filler order number. At some sites, this may be the pharmacy or treatment system (internal) sequential form. At other sites, this may be an external form. This is a required field in RXE when used in pharmacy/treatment messages, but it is not required when used in product experience messages (see Chapter 7).

fields.name: Number of Refills Remaining
fields.desc: Number of refills remaining. This field is conditional because it is required when a prescription is dispensed to an outpatient. It is not relevant to inpatient treatment orders.

fields.name: Number of Refills/Doses Dispensed
fields.desc: Number of refills dispensed. This field is conditional because it is required when a prescription is dispensed to an outpatient. It is not relevant to inpatient treatment orders.

fields.name: D/T of Most Recent Refill or Dose Dispensed
fields.desc: Date/time of the most recent refill or dose dispensed.

fields.name: Total Daily Dose
fields.desc: This field contains the total daily dose for this particular pharmaceutical as expressed in terms of actual dispense units.

fields.name: Needs Human Review
fields.desc: This field uses HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator . The values have the following meaning for this field:

fields.name: Pharmacy/Treatment Supplier s Special Dispensing Instructions
fields.desc: This field contains the pharmacy or treatment supplier's provider-generated special instructions to the provider dispensing/administering the order.

fields.name: Give Per
fields.desc: This field contains the time unit to use to calculate the rate at which the pharmaceutical is to be administered.

fields.name: Give Rate Amount
fields.desc: This field contains the rate at which the substance should be administered.

fields.name: Give Rate Units
fields.desc: This field contains the units for RXE-23-give rate amount . May be composite. The ratio of the RXE-23-give rate amount and RXE-24-give rate units defines the actual rate of administration. Thus, if RXE-23-give rate amount = 100 and RXE-24-give rate units = ml/hr, the requested rate of administration is 100 ml/hr. (See ISO+ Figure 7-13 in Chapter 7 for possible compound units codes.)

fields.name: Give Strength
fields.desc: Use when RXE-2-give code does not specify the strength. This is the numeric part of the strength, used in combination with RXE-26-give strength units.

fields.name: Give Strength Units
fields.desc: Use when RXE-2-give code does not specify the strength. This is the unit of the strength, used in combination with RXE-25-give strength.

fields.name: Give Indication
fields.desc: This field identifies the condition or problem for which the drug/treatment was prescribed. May repeat if multiple indications are relevant.

fields.name: Dispense Package Size
fields.desc: This field contains the size of package to be dispensed. Units are transmitted in RXE-29-dispense package size unit.

fields.name: Dispense Package Size Unit
fields.desc: This field contains the units in which RXE-28-dispense package size is denominated.

fields.name: Dispense Package Method
fields.desc: This field contains the method by which treatment is dispensed. Refer to HL7 table 0321 - Dispense method for valid values.

fields.name: Set ID - PID
fields.desc: This field contains the number that identifies this transaction. For the first occurrence of the segment, the sequence number shall be one, for the second occurrence, the sequence number shall be two, etc.

fields.name: Patient ID
fields.desc: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only. With HL7 v2.3.1, the arbitrary term of 'external ID' has been removed from the name of this field. The repetition, assigning authority, facility, and identifier type code attributes of PID-3-patient identifier list allow for distinctive identifier representation. This field remains for systems with a negotiated understanding of 'external.' It is recommended to use PID-3-patient identifier list for all patient identifiers.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: Patient Identifier List
fields.desc: This field contains the list of identifiers (one or more) used by the facility to uniquely identify a patient (e.g., medical record number, billing number, birth registry, national unique individual identifier, etc.). Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme for valid values. With HL7 v2.3.1, the arbitrary term of 'internal ID' has been removed from the name of this field for clarity.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: Alternate Patient ID - PID
fields.desc: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only. It is recommended to use PID-3-patient identifier list for all patient identifiers. When used for backward compatibility, this field contains the alternate, temporary, or pending optional patient identifier to be used if needed - or additional numbers that may be required to identify a patient. This field may be used to convey multiple patient IDs when more than one exist for a patient. Possible contents might include a visit number, a visit date, or a Social Security Number.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: Patient Name
fields.desc: This field contains the legal name of the patient. All other names for the patient should be sent in PID-9-patient alias . Therefore, the name type code in this field should be 'L - Legal.' Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values. Repetition of this field is allowed for representing the same name in different character sets. Please refer to the PN data type.

fields.name: Mother s Maiden Name
fields.desc: This field contains the family name under which the mother was born (i.e., before marriage). It is used to distinguish between patients with the same last name.

fields.name: Date/Time Of Birth
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's date and time of birth.

fields.name: Sex
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's sex. Refer to user-definedtable 0001 - Sex for suggested values.

fields.name: Patient Alias
fields.desc: This field contains the name(s) by which the patient has been known at some time. Refer to HL7 table 0200 - Name type for valid values.

fields.name: Race
fields.desc: This field refers to the patient's race. User-defined table 0005 - Race is used as the HL7 identifier or the user-defined table of values for this field. The second triplet of the CE data type for race (alternate identifier, alternate text, and name of alternate coding system) is reserved for governmentally assigned codes.

fields.name: Patient Address
fields.desc: This field contains the mailing address of the patient. Address type codes are defined by HL7; see HL7 table 0190 - Address type . Multiple addresses for the same person may be sent in the following sequence: The primary mailing address must be sent first in the sequence (for backward compatibility); if the mailing address is not sent, then a repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence.

fields.name: County Code
fields.desc: This field has been retained for backward compatibility. This field contains the patient's county code. The county can now be supported in the county/parish code component of the XAD data type (PID-11-patient address). User-defined table 0289 - County/parish is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Phone Number - Home
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's personal phone numbers. All personal phone numbers for the patient are sent in the following sequence. The first sequence is considered the primary number (for backward compatibility). If the primary number is not sent, then a repeat delimiter is sent in the first sequence. Refer to HL7 tables 0201 - Telecommunication use code and 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Phone Number - Business
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's business telephone numbers. All business numbers for the patient are sent in the following sequence. The first sequence is considered the patient's primary business phone number (for backward compatibility). If the primary business phone number is not sent, then a repeat delimiter must be sent in the first sequence. Refer to HL7 tables 0201 - Telecommunication use code and 0202 - Telecommunication equipment type for valid values.

fields.name: Primary Language
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's primary language. HL7 recommends using ISO table 639 as the suggested values in user-defined table 0296 - Language.

fields.name: Marital Status
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's marital status. Refer to user-defined table 0002 - Marital status for suggested values.

fields.name: Religion
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's religion, for example, Baptist, Catholic, Methodist, etc. User-defined table 0006 - Religion is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field..

fields.name: Patient Account Number
fields.desc: This field contains the patient account number assigned by accounting to which all charges, payments, etc., are recorded. It is used to identify the patient's account. Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme in Chapter 2.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: SSN Number - Patient
fields.desc: This field has been retained for backward compatibility only. It is recommended to use PID-3-patient identifier list for all patient identifiers. However, in order to maintain backward compatibility, this field should also be populated. You may additionally report the SSN number in PID-3 patient identifier list. When used for backward compatibility, this field contains the patient's social security number. This number may also be a RR retirement number.

fields.name: Driver's License Number - Patient
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's driver's license number. Some sites may use this number as a unique identifier of the patient. The default of the second component is the state in which the patient's license is registered.

fields.name: Mother's Identifier
fields.desc: This field is used, for example, as a link field for newborns. Typically a patient ID or account number may be used. This field can contain multiple identifiers for the same mother. Refer to HL7 table 0061 - Check digit scheme as defined in Chapter 2.
fields.dataTypeName: Extended Composite ID With Check Digit

fields.name: Ethnic Group
fields.desc: This field further defines the patient's ancestry. User-definedtable 0189 - Ethnic group is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field. ERISA has a published list of ethnic classifications that may be used by local agreement at a site. The second triplet of the CE data type for ethnic group (alternate identifier, alternate text, and name of alternate coding system) is reserved for governmentally assigned codes.

fields.name: Birth Place
fields.desc: This field indicates the location of the patient's birth.

fields.name: Multiple Birth Indicator
fields.desc: This field indicates whether the patient was part of a multiple birth. Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/No indicator as described in Chapter 2.

fields.name: Birth Order
fields.desc: When a patient was part of a multiple birth, a value (number) indicating the patient's birth order is entered in this field.

fields.name: Citizenship
fields.desc: This field contains the patient's country of citizenship. HL7 recommends using ISO table 3166 as the suggested values in user-defined table 0171 - Citizenship.

fields.name: Veterans Military Status
fields.desc: This field contains the military status assigned to a veteran. User-defined table 0172 - Veterans military status is used as the HL7 identifier for the user-defined table of values for this field.

fields.name: Nationality
fields.desc: This field contains a code that identifies the nation or national grouping to which the person belongs. This information may be different from a person's citizenship in countries in which multiple nationalities are recognized (for example, Spain: Basque, Catalan, etc.). HL7 recommends using ISO table 3166 as the suggested values in user-defined table 0212 - Nationality .

fields.name: Patient Death Date and Time
fields.desc: This field contains the date and time at which the patient death occurred.

fields.name: Patient Death Indicator
fields.desc: This field indicates whether or not the patient is deceased. Refer to Chapter 2, HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values.

fields.name: Statistics Available
fields.desc: This field contains an indicator if statistics are available.  Refer to HL7 table 0136 - Yes/no indicator for valid values

fields.name: Source Identifier
fields.desc: This field identifies a particular lower level link (e.g., a port number).

fields.name: Source Type
fields.desc: This field identifies (in certain systems) whether a lower level source identifier is an initiate or accept type.   Refer to HL7 table 0332 - Network source type for valid values.

fields.name: Statistics Start
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time stamp of the start of the collection of the statistics reported in fields 6-15 of this segment.  It is strongly recommended that this value include seconds

fields.name: Statistics End
fields.desc: This field contains the date/time stamp of the end of the statistics collection period reported in fields 6-15 of this segment.  It is strongly recommended that this value include seconds

fields.name: Receive Character Count
fields.desc: This field contains the number of characters received

fields.name: Send Character Count
fields.desc: This field contains the number of characters sent

fields.name: Messages Received
fields.desc: This field contains the number of messages received

fields.name: Messages Sent
fields.desc: This field contains the number of messages sent

fields.name: Checksum Errors Received
fields.desc: This field contains the number of messages received with checksum errors

fields.name: Length Errors Received
